news_header: Sergey Šoigu warns of increased risk of armed conflict between nuclear states due to NATO's activities near Russia.
news_text: Sergey Šoigu, Secretary of the Russian Security Council and former Minister of Defence, has warned that the risk of armed conflict between nuclear states is on the rise. He highlighted a potential military threat stemming from major powers' inability to manage their differences. Additionally, Šoigu accused NATO of escalating activities near the Russian-Belarusian border and conducting training in the Baltic region. Russia has threatened 'countermeasures' if NATO continues to increase its presence in border areas.
